notesStmt.note: Edges trimmed unevenly, with small folds at joins.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

layoutDesc.layout: Columns: 147; ruled lines: 57 58; written lines: 57 58; Uniform layout. Ruling by hard point. Visible pricking and stitching. 147 columns in total, two to four columns per membrane. Three tagin on שעטנזגץ, and one on אבדהחיספקת. The letters ש and צ sometimes provided with four tagin, and ט and צ sometimes with five tagin. The letters בהכךמםספףקת occasionally with three tagin, and on הכמפר sometimes two. The letter ח arched throughout. Several instances of majuscular and minuscular letters. Special shapes of the letter ו, נ, פ, ע, ח, ז, י, ל, ס, ר occur. The inverted נ before and after Num. 10:35-36 is missing. The "puncta extraordinaria" placed on the words fixed by masorah. Wooden rollers (870mm high).

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Ashkenazi square script of the 17th century.

history.provenance: Acquisition: Presented to the British Museum by Rev. Thomas Butler on 05 July 1841.
